name: Ensoniq SQ-80 Disk Image
summary: Learn about .EDS files and view a list of programs that open them.

windows.name: Open over 400 file formats with File Viewer Plus.Free Download

content: Ensoniq produced the SQ-80 from 1987 to 1989. The synthesizer followed the ESQ-1, which was Ensoniq's first synthesizer. The SQ-80 featured an improved sequencer, more sounds and instruments, and a floppy drive for sharing sound data via floppy disks.

description: An EDS file is a disk image formatted for an Ensoniq SQ-80 synthesizer, a digital workstation released by Ensoniq in 1987. It contains data dumped from a floppy disk, which includes sequences and effects. SQ-80 users would use floppy disks to add sequences and effects to the synthesizer, but users dump the data from the disks to EDS files to play their sounds.

instructions: You can open an EDS file with Chicken Systems Ensoniq Disk Tools in Windows.
